page.title: 07BUXTON MILL
page.content: There has been a mill at Buxton since before the{Norman Conquest.}It was certainly mentioned in the{Domesday {Book.}It ceased to work as a mill in 1970 when it became a{crafts and {arts centre.}The present building was built in the 18th century. The main building now houses the following: an Antique department specialising in pine furniture, an artist/designer's workshop, a model maker's workshop, spinning and weaving, picture framing, a general craft area and an upholstery and furniture company. Also on the site there is a{Freehouse {and Restaurant. Attached to the main building, in what was the mill office, is a small{hotel whose bedrooms provide superb views of the River Bure and mill_stream. The mill is well known.
